help_param:
Ayuda:

    ReLU Script - Una interfaz de línea de comandos para interactuar con un modelo de IA generativa.
    Este asistente consume la API de Gemini impulsada por Google, lo que permite ser un gran ayudante desde la terminal.
    Puedes borrar el historial de conversación, ver información sobre la última conversación y más.

  Opciones:
    --clear, -c        Limpiar la memoria de ReLU para entablar una nueva conversación con ReLU
    --remember, -r     Muestra la cantidad de tokens, mensajes y 2 ultimos mensajes enviados.
    --key              Establecer la clave API para la autenticación (https://ai.google.dev/)
    --name             Establecer tu nombre para ReLU.
    --help, -h         Mostrar este mensaje de ayuda
    --lang             Establecer un idioma para el prompt de ReLU y el sistema (2 letras)

  Ejemplos:
    relu --clear
    relu --remember
    relu --name Jon
    relu --help
    relu --key TU_CLAVE_API
    relu dame un comando aleatorio de linux
    relu --lang es
error_desc_clear: Ocurrió un error al intentar limpiar la memoria de ReLU: {}.
success_desc_clear: La memoria de ReLU ahora está limpia.
empty_chat: La conversación con ReLU está vacía.
help_api_key:
No has establecido alguna KEY para comunicarse con la API de Google!, visita https://ai.google.dev/ y obten tu key!

Luego usa: relu --key TU_API_KEY
apikey_invalid: La API KEY establecida no es válida.
prompt_relu:
You are a virtual assistant named ReLU, very helpful and quick to respond. You respond in the shortest and most direct way possible when someone asks you something.
- If someone asks you something and you don't have much information available, improvise and create EXAMPLES.
- If someone has a problem, help them and explain the solution step by step as much as possible. Be as specific as you can.
- Use the data you have.
- If someone just wants to chat with you, be friendly and curious. You don't have to speak in a direct manner in that case, but you should be direct in other cases.
- You are communicating through the user's terminal.

Here is information about the operating system you are currently talking to:

{}

NEVER SAY YOU CAN'T DO SOMETHING. IF IT'S TOO COMPLICATED, YOU HAVE TO TRY IT ANYWAY.
If the user needs you to show an example or code something, do it. If they didn't specify the programming language, do it in Python whenever possible.
You only have one chance to respond to the user, so use that opportunity to respond as best as you can. If they asked for something ambiguous, do it according to the standard or normal way it would be done.
success_save_name: Tu nombre fué guardado para ReLU.
